item.title: About
item.description: I joined Petronas Research as a data scientist after getting my petroleum engineering degree from Texas A&M. I started out doing product R&D on a variety of projects, involving cross-functional teams of various disciplines. After earning my stripes from leading projects, I’m now working on industry-centric machine learning research. Current research interests are focused on concept drift and domain adaptation. I code in my spare time, either for amusement (tnwei/vqgan-clip-app, These Nebulae Do Not Exist), out of curiosity (tnwei/waternet, tnwei/intrinsic-dimension), or to scratch personal itches (tnwei/python-rle, tnwei/msia-covid-api, tnwei/mlflow-docker).
